content: guide on how to start this project this is just a small example in case you want to test it first with some left over yarn and any hook in order to understand how it works before you start though it is the same system as the start of this blanket the number of chains is much smaller in this example follow the main pattern row 1a and 1b to get started with the blanket example 1a chain 44 start in 6th chain from the hook dc1 ch1 sk1 x 19 times double_crochet in the last chain you should have 20 windows 1b chain 42 lay your chain over the trellis and starting in the second a window through the 6th chain from the hook b18 f1 1 you first make a chain with the a colour 2 in the 6th chain from the hook make a double_crochet and chain 1 3 skip a chain and make another double_crochet and chain 1 repeat this throughout the chain… © astrid schandy 2024 aschandy@yahoo no astrid s diagonals sample 9 4 until you reach your first chain with your last double_crochet you should count that you have the 20 windows needed 5 with colour b make the chain as requested 6 yarn over and send your hook through the 2nd a window from back to front to fetch the b chain through the 6th chain from hook… 7 and once you have the 6th chain in your hook you pull it back gently to finish your double_crochet… © astrid schandy 2024 aschandy@yahoo no astrid s diagonals sample 10 8 and you have now made a b1 or dcib double_crochet in the back 9 continue making dcib throughout 10 until you have one stitch left 11 the last stitch is in the front so yarn over and through the front of your work catch the last chain and make your last double_crochet 12 and you made it ready for next row row start with chain 3 i have the habit of making those 3 chains at the end of the previous row end of document © astrid schandy 2024 aschandy@yahoo no astrid s diagonals sample 11
